page.title: 09A driver's perspective
page.content: When travelling on the A445,it is possible to see many of the area's dominant features-sand/gravel extraction,landfill,mixed farming, ecological conservation areas(Ryton Pool,Ryton Wood),Bubbenhall village with its school and church,gently undulating countryside-from the driving seat.The road also passes the Police Training College at Ryton,and affords distant views of the Talbot car works at Ryton,part of Coventry, the National Agricultural Centre at Stoneleigh,Bagington airport,and Leamington Spa.The B4453 passes The Woodhouse Hotel and Princethorpe College,and joins the Fosse Way.It is a quieter,more scenic route with extensive views across open farmland and deciduous woodland.Several minor roads link the A445/B4453.
